How To Reach Ranthambore National Park

Ranthambore is a famous wildlife destination in Rajasthan's Sawai Madhopur. Here's complete travel information for tourists visiting Ranthambore National Park.

By Air

The nearest Airport to Ranthambore National Park is Jaipur International Airport (JAI) and as the name says, this is located in Jaipur. This park is approximately 160 kilometers (100 miles) away from Ranthambore and the distance will take around 3 to 4 hours to cover.

By Train

The nearest railway station from this spot is Sawai Madhopur Railway Station which is around 10 km. From the railway station, you can take any local transport to reach Ranthambore National Park.

By Road

This park is close to many famous cities like Jaipur, Delhi Agra etc. Here is the approximate distance from nearby cities:

  • From Jaipur: 160 km (3-4 hours)
  • From Delhi: 390 km (7-8 hours)
  • From Agra: 260 km (5-6 hours)

Travel Tips:

  • Book transport in advance during peak season (October-March)
  • Consider hiring a local guide for better wildlife spotting
  • Early morning departures recommended for best wildlife viewing
